sense.def:
There is a strain on something
rečemo, kadar mora nekaj držati ali nekdo storiti več, kot je normalno, in se zato lahko zlomi ali postane neučinkovito.

seg.quote: The additional supports will help to take some of the strain off the original structure.
Civil defence forces were under heavy strain.
This policy puts a greater strain on the economic system than it can bear.

sense.def:
Strain
je stanje zaskrbljenosti in napetosti.

seg.quote: Many people doing this sort of job suffer from strain.

sense.def:
A strain of a plant
je vrsta rastline.

To hear strains of music
pomeni slišati, kako igrajo glasbo;

seg.quote: The strains of Chopin drifted in from the music room.

sense.def:
To strain something
pomeni nekaj uporabljati prek normalnih ali razumnih meja.

seg.quote: The oil-price increases have strained the resources of the poorer countries.

sense.def:
To strain to do something
pomeni močno se potruditi, da bi nekaj naredili.

seg.quote: He was straining to hear what the speaker was saying.
He strained his eyes to catch a glimpse of the President.

sense.def:
To strain a muscle
pomeni poškodovati mišico tako, da jo preveč uporabljamo.

To strain food
pomeni izliti tekočino iz nečesa.
